channel.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
channel.description:
[ul][center][img]http://i.imgur.com/goNKV.png[/img][/center]
[size=14pt][b]Introduction:[/b][/size] I've been working on random things lately, didn't have any inspiration. I started loading everything I found through XML just for the lulz, but started writing other things after a while, and decided to continue this project.
[b]Base: Cleaned and fresh packaged Delta[/b]
[size=14pt][b]Planning to do:[/b][/size] [list] [li]New from scratch trading.[/li] [li]Brand new from scratch combat system.[/li] [li]Upgrading npc updating.[/li] [li]Upgrading playerupdating.[/li] [li]New from scratch written shopping.[/li] [/list]
[size=14pt][b]Done:[/b][/size] [list] [li][b]Implemented netty.[/b][/li] [li][b]Processes running on Graham's task system.[/b][/li] [li][b]Implemented and modified PI's package managing system.[/b][/li] [li][b]Completely new from scratch item handling, this includes:[/b][/li] [list] [li]Inventory managing[/li] [li]Bank managing[/li] [li]wearing, equipping, unequipping[/li] [li]switching[/li] [li]dropping & grounditems[/li] [li]global items[/li] [li]equip emote managing[/li] [li]defs, bonuses, requirements, equipemotes etc... via XML[/li] [/list] [li][b]New Npc managing system with new design.[/b] [list] [li]Npc definitions and spawns loaded from XML.[/li] [li]New clean movement handling.[/li] [li]Movement now only updates via the player itself when the npc is close. Originally it was updating via the player and via the npc-system as well.[/li] [li]Communication System (yelling; forced yell; private, regional and global messaging in chat.)[/li] [li]npc-combat[/li] [li]npcs can now follow players (for combat) and are clipped.[/li] [li]npcs now randomly walk around in a defined(clipped) area.[/li] [li]Npcs will now drop items loaded via XML when killed by a player.[/li] [li]Npc now have an animation when dying loaded via XML. [/li][/list] [/li] [li][b]New from scratch written banking.[/b] - Includes bank filling (filling empty spots)[/li] [li][b]Cleaned all unused and dead code as well as working on conventions:[/b] e.g. I've set everything in the huge player class private, removed all unnused code and made gather and setters for the used ones.[/li] [/list]
[size=14pt][b]Media:[/b][/size]
Dc'd at 700, Managed to hold 800 without running a bunch of other stuff on my computer but whatever, they aren't active players anyways. Trying to improve this since I hoped for 1k after netty Implementation and other tweeks. [img]http://i.imgur.com/hVvSW.png[/img]
Banking with filling free spots: [img]http://gifninja.com/animatedgifs/401622/banking-filling.gif[/img]
Switching: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=THGMzCTMm98[/youtube]
Npc Communication: [img]http://i.imgur.com/661Q1.png[/img][/ul]

item.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Been playing farCry3 all the time, will leave it asside tomorrow and write whole combat.
I decided that I’m going to release this. Still gotto do combat like mentioned above, shopping and trading.
Then everything is pretty much functioning, ready to add gameplay content. So that’ll be up to the downloaders.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:25, topic:469947”][ul]Latest NPC managing updates:
[list]
[li]npcs can now follow players (for combat) and are clipped.[/li]
[li]npcs now randomly walk around in a defined(clipped) area.[/li]
[li]Npcs will now drop items loaded via XML when killed by a player.[/li]
[li]Npc now have an animation when dying loaded via XML.
(fighting, walking and blocking are also loaded but there’s no use for it yet since I didn’t make combat yet. As for walking I didn’t configure others npcs apart from a man yet.)[/li][/list]

K6bQR.png884×307
[/ul][/quote]
nice :o

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Tmesis, post:22, topic:469947”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=587267.msg4168947#msg4168947 date=1354045545]
Known bug: after respawning the moving speed of the npc is like fucking fast. Didn’t figure out yet how this is even possible.
[/quote]
Just an idea: are you unregistering them and registering them properly?[/quote]
No I wasn’t, I was just stopping them from updating. I indeed had to unregister and register again to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Latest update: (will go slow now until saturday due school(wed,thi,fri)

  • The chattext of the npc is now blue.
  • Npc will now die when their HP is equal or below zero (and if they are attackable obviously)
    *with emote
    *drops bones only now, dropsystem still has to be written
  • Npc’s respawn after dying.

Known bug: after respawning the moving speed of the npc is like fucking fast. Didn’t figure out yet how this is even possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:14, topic:469947”]Npcs are now able to communicate in these forms:

  • yelling constantly via a timer. (e.g. every 5 seconds a man yells “RandQm!”)
  • forced yelling (the npc will only yell a certain text once, can be used for e.g. getting caught at thieving)
  • sending a message via chat to a player
  • sending a message via chat to all closest players
  • sending a message via chat to all players online

[/quote]
hmm

looks interesting :o

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Future ~ wL revolution
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I’m working on a new npc managing system from scratch,
I did this before for PZ which I also used in DalaCity, but this time I’m also going for a new design instead of following wL’s.

What I’ve done so far:

  • Npc definitions and spawns loaded from XML.
  • New clean movement handling.
  • Movement now only updates via the player itself when the npc is close.
    Originally it was updating via the player and via the npc-system as well.

Read full topic
